@graph.name: The Best Vegan Cheesecake - Nora Cooks
@graph.description: Learn how to make the best vegan cheesecake ever! No, really! This cheesecake is light, creamy and smooth with no dairy or nuts.

@graph.name: The Best Vegan Cheesecake
@graph.description: Learn how to make the best vegan cheesecake ever! No, really! This cheesecake is light, creamy and smooth with no dairy or nuts. Plus, it's easy to make and you don't need a high powered blender!

video.name: The Best Vegan Cheesecake
video.description: Learn how to make the best vegan cheesecake ever! No, really! This cheesecake is light, creamy and smooth with no dairy or nuts. Plus, it’s easy to make and you don’t need a high powered blender!

recipeIngredient: 5 tablespoons melted coconut oil (*or vegan butter)
32 ounces (4 8-ounce packages) vegan cream cheese (*I used Tofutti brand, see notes)
3  tablespoons lemon juice, from about 2 small lemons
1 1/2 cups fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced
1 teaspoon lemon zest, from 1 small lemon

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Wrap a 9 inch springform pan with 1-2 layers of aluminum foil, covering the bottom and the sides. Cut a circle of parchment paper for the bottom of the pan, and spray lightly with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Wrap a 9 inch springform pan with 1-2 layers of aluminum foil, covering the bottom and the sides. Cut a circle of parchment paper for the bottom of the pan, and spray lightly with oil.

itemListElement.text: In a medium bowl, add the cookie crumbs, melted coconut oil and sugar. Stir well to combine, then press down into the bottom of the prepared pan. Press down firmly and evenly, going up the sides a little. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: In a medium bowl, add the cookie crumbs, melted coconut oil and sugar. Stir well to combine, then press down into the bottom of the prepared pan. Press down firmly and evenly, going up the sides a little. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: In the bowl of an electric mixer with the whisk attachment, or using a handheld mixer, beat the vegan cream cheese until smooth, about 1 minute.
itemListElement.name: In the bowl of an electric mixer with the whisk attachment, or using a handheld mixer, beat the vegan cream cheese until smooth, about 1 minute.

itemListElement.text: Now add the rest of the filling ingredients and beat until smooth, scraping down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.
itemListElement.name: Now add the rest of the filling ingredients and beat until smooth, scraping down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.

itemListElement.text: Once it's completely smooth, pour into prepared pan over the crust and spread evenly.
itemListElement.name: Once it's completely smooth, pour into prepared pan over the crust and spread evenly.

itemListElement.text: Place in the oven and bake for 50 minutes. Do not open the oven door during this time. Turn off the heat, and let it sit in the oven for 10 more minutes. The cheesecake will be slightly jiggly, and not look very done in the middle. That is correct, it will firm up when it cools.
itemListElement.name: Place in the oven and bake for 50 minutes. Do not open the oven door during this time. Turn off the heat, and let it sit in the oven for 10 more minutes. The cheesecake will be slightly jiggly, and not look very done in the middle. That is correct, it will firm up when it cools.

itemListElement.text: Remove from the oven, and let it cool for about 15 minutes at room temperature before moving to the refrigerator to cool for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight, before slicing and serving. When ready to serve, slice and serve with any optional toppings.
itemListElement.name: Remove from the oven, and let it cool for about 15 minutes at room temperature before moving to the refrigerator to cool for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight, before slicing and serving. When ready to serve, slice and serve with any optional toppings.

itemListElement.text: In a food processor, add 1 1/4 cups of the sliced strawberries (reserving 1/4 cup), sugar and lemon zest. Process until smooth. Toss with the sliced strawberries in a small bowl and chill for at least an hour before serving.
itemListElement.name: In a food processor, add 1 1/4 cups of the sliced strawberries (reserving 1/4 cup), sugar and lemon zest. Process until smooth. Toss with the sliced strawberries in a small bowl and chill for at least an hour before serving.
